title: Hebrew (1898) Letteris Old Testament
description: The 1866 Letteris edition of the Masoretic text, created by Max Letteris for the British and Foreign Bible Society, stands out as a significant contribution to the printing of the Hebrew Bible. Max Letteris, a noted poet and printer from Amsterdam, crafted an edition that gained immense popularity, widely reprinted across both Jewish and Christian communities. This edition is renowned for its accuracy and readability, making it a valuable resource in the study and dissemination of Hebrew scriptures during the late 19th century. The widespread acceptance and use of the Letteris edition in diverse religious circles highlight its impact and importance in the history of biblical publications, exemplifying its role in enhancing the accessibility and understanding of the Hebrew scriptures.
